intro: Psychotria duckei, commonly known as the "duck's psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Psychotria duckei is also noted for its role in supporting local ecosystems, particularly as a food source for certain insect pollinators.
